examples.sentence: The chemistry lab smells like rotten eggs today.
We built a DIY lab in the garage to test rocket models.
The AI lab at Tsinghua is developing mind-reading algorithms.
Panda conservation labs often smell like bamboo and feces.
Traditional cheese makers use lab extracted from calf stomachs.
Vegetarian lab substitutes are made from microbial sources.
The nutrition label says this bubble tea contains 12 sugar cubes worth of sweetness.
She carefully removed the price label from her new designer bag.
The 'Iron Man' label stuck to Elon Musk after he sent a Tesla into space.
Rejecting the 'leftover woman' label, she started a successful business.
The red Coca-Cola label is recognized globally.
Workers are labeling jars of Lao Gan Ma chili sauce at lightning speed.
The museum labeled the dinosaur fossils with QR codes.
The map labels all hotpot restaurants within 1km radius.
Costco's private label Kirkland often outperforms name brands.
Don't label me as a workaholic just because I check WeChat constantly!
The museum exhibits are all labelled with QR codes for augmented reality.
Her suitcase was labelled 'Fragile' in three languages.
Spicy crayfish was labelled as a 'must-try' in the food guide.
The pre-labelled vaccine vials saved nurses' time.
The AI system uses dynamic labelling for image recognition.
In Python programming, proper labelling makes your code readable.
The nutrition labelling on bubble tea shows shocking sugar content.
Accurate drug labelling saves lives in hospitals.
CRISPR technology enables precise gene labelling.
The bug was caused by incorrect error labelling in the dataset.
The labile mood of cryptocurrency markets gives investors sleepless nights.
His labile temper is like a volcano that may erupt anytime.
The political situation in that region remains labile as popcorn in a microwave.
Teenagers' fashion preferences are notoriously labile.
The Great Wall stands as a monument to ancient Chinese labor.
Labor Day reminds us to honor delivery riders under the sun.
Her labor finally paid off with a Peking University admission.
The tech company provides dormitories for its labors.
The panda in the zoo went into labor at midnight.
Migrant workers labor in cities to build skyscrapers.
The professor labored the students with endless formulas.
The labor union negotiated for better meal subsidies.
College students doing manual labor learn to value takeout riders.

Her laboratory coat has Hello Kitty prints.
The AI laboratory at Tsinghua looks like a spaceship.
We turned our garage into a cryptocurrency laboratory.
The perfume laboratory produces 10 tons of rose essence annually.
They disguised the drug laboratory as a fertilizer plant.
Our language laboratory has VR equipment for immersion practice.
The transgenic mice became celebrities in the laboratory animal circle.

examples.sentence: The laborious climb up Mount Tai was rewarded with breathtaking sunrise.
Writing a 50,000-word thesis in three days is truly laborious.
Deciphering his handwriting is more laborious than solving calculus problems.
The laborious process of applying for a visa made her reconsider traveling abroad.
The laborious ants stored enough food for the entire winter.
Her laborious efforts in practicing calligraphy won her first prize in the competition.

examples.sentence: Migrant workers built the Bird's Nest laboriously under extreme weather.
She finished her doctoral thesis laboriously after 5 all-nighters.
The old computer booted up laboriously like a rusty bicycle.
He climbed the Great Wall laboriously with a 20kg camera bag.
The beginner played FÃ¼r Elise laboriously with wrong notes.
The machine translation rendered the poem laboriously without rhythm.
The 2G network loaded videos laboriously slow like a snail marathon.

examples.sentence: Chinese farmers' labour created the terraced fields that feed millions.
The Great Wall stands as a monument to ancient labour.
His decade-long labour finally resulted in a Michelin-starred restaurant.
The labour of compiling the dictionary took 15 years.
Migrant labour constitutes 30% of urban workforce in China.
Labour disputes often involve overtime pay issues.
The panda in the zoo is in labour right now.
Midwives assist women during labour with traditional techniques.
Peasants labour in the rice fields from dawn to dusk.
Construction workers labour under the scorching sun.
Students labour over their gaokao preparation.
She laboured to master the intricate embroidery technique.
The professor laboured the point with 20 case studies.
Don't labour the obvious - we all know the basics.
His long-winded explanation laboured the audience.
The repetitive training laboured the new employees.
Many office workers labour under chronic back pain.
College students doing manual labour is part of Chinese education tradition.
The migrant labourers build skyscrapers with their calloused hands.
Ancient Egyptian labourers moved pyramid stones like human ants.
Construction labourers wield jackhammers like modern Thor's hammers.
The strawberry-picking labourers bend under the sun like question marks.
The factory labourers assemble smartphones faster than robots.
19th-century railway labourers laid tracks with barefoot determination.
Migrant labourers send home money wrapped in newspaper.
Day labourers queue at dawn like human vending machines.
The Forbidden City was designed like a labyrinth to confuse invaders.
Ikea's showroom is a colorful labyrinth of Scandinavian furniture.
China's housing policy is a labyrinth to foreign investors.
Her weibo feed became a labyrinth of celebrity gossip.
Without Baidu Maps, the hutongs are pure labyrinth.
The subway transfer stations feel like a labyrinth during rush hour.
The labyrinth of paperwork made starting a business difficult.

examples.sentence: The hutong alleys form a labyrinthine network that even locals get lost in.
Her labyrinthine explanation about blockchain confused everyone.
The hanfu's lace fluttered like butterfly wings in the wind.
She collected vintage lace from Qing Dynasty embroidery.
His neon-lit sneaker laces glow in dark basketball courts.
Tying your own shoe laces is the first independence lesson.
The designer laced the cheongsam with golden thread.
Mooncakes are sometimes laced with intricate patterns.
She laced up her hiking boots before climbing Mount Tai.
The corset laces at the back like ancient armor.
The critic laced into the movie like untying knotted shoelaces.
The milk tea was laced with anxiety-relieving herbs.

examples.sentence: The cat lacerated the sofa with its sharp claws.
Broken glass lacerated his palm during the accident.
Her betrayal lacerated his heart like a serrated knife.
The documentary lacerated viewers with its cruel truths.
The lacerate pages of the diary told a violent story.
Wind howled through the lacerate sails of the ship.
The critic lacerated the novel with sarcastic comments.
The lacerated teddy bear needed emergency sewing surgery.
Lacerated jeans became a trendy streetwear style.
The chef presented lacerated cabbage for hot pot dipping.
Archaeologists found lacerated parchment in the tomb.
His lacerated pride needed more time to heal than his knee.
The lacerated tree trunk oozed sap like nature's band-aid.
The chef got a laceration from the sushi knife while cutting tuna.
Glass shards caused multiple lacerations on the cat's paws.
The football player needed 5 stitches for his forehead laceration.
Mountain bike accidents often result in deep lacerations.
The survivor had deep lacerations from the bear attack.
The bride's veil was made of delicate lacework that took three months to complete.
This traditional Irish lacework resembles spider webs glistening with morning dew.
Her cheongsam was adorned with intricate lacework along the collar.
The Victorian pillowcases featured lacework so fine it looked like frozen lacework.
The museum displayed 17th-century lacework embroidery from French royal courts.
The ballet dancer's pink lacing broke during the pirouette.
These Hanfu designs feature intricate silk lacings.
The milk tea has a lacing of Irish whiskey.
Grandma's porridge always had a lacing of honey.
Lacing up your sneakers properly prevents blisters.
The lack of chili sauce made the hotpot taste like bathwater.
His presentation suffered from a severe lack of memes.
There's a complete lack of sincerity in his 'read receipts'.
The lack of sleep turned her into a zombie during meetings.
This instant noodles lacks the promised beef chunks.
Young people today lack the patience to watch buffering videos.
Your resume lacks relevant internship experience.
Modern relationships often lack deep communication.
They canceled the camping for lack of bug spray.
There's no lack of keyboard warriors on Weibo.

examples.sentence: The panda's lackadaisical chewing of bamboo went viral on Douyin.
His lackadaisical attitude towards final exams shocked his parents.
The poet wrote lackadaisical verses after drinking chrysanthemum wine.
Her lackadaisical sigh echoed through the empty teahouse.
Don't be lackadaisical about submitting your health code.
The Victorian mansion had lackeys in striped waistcoats serving champagne.
A Disneyland lackey helped Cinderella find her lost glass slipper.
The CEO's lackeys always laugh three seconds earlier at his jokes.
Those influencer's lackeys flooded the comments with emoji rainbows.
He lackeyed the professor by carrying her Starbucks order every morning.
The intern lackeyed the manager by memorizing his coffee preferences.
The senator brought five political lackeys to carry his briefcases.
His resume is painfully lacking in work experience.
The new housing project is lacking basic facilities like grocery stores.
The investigation was criticized for lacking thoroughness.
Her explanation was lacking in convincing details.
This instant noodle flavor is seriously lacking in authenticity.

examples.sentence: His laconic reply 'Nope' ended the interview.
The CEO's laconic email simply said: 'Fix it.'
IKEA instructions are famously laconic with no words.
Her laconic presentation used only 10 slides.
Xiaomi's laconic product launches focus on specs, not fluff.
When asked about his success, the CEO replied laconically: 'Luck.'
The judge laconically wrote 'Denied' on the appeal document.
The Forbidden City's red lacquer has withstood 600 years of weathering.
This nail lacquer changes color with temperature like a mood ring.
Fuzhou bodiless lacquer is as light as a cicada's wing.
The lacquer tea set reflected the candlelight like liquid gold.
Workers lacquered the wooden beams with 18 layers of tung oil.
She lacquered her notebook with clear coat to preserve the doodles.
The piano's lacquer finish mirrored the concert hall's chandeliers.
The craftsman lacquered the wooden box with 12 layers of urushi.
Her nails were lacquered in forbidden city red for the meeting.
This Qianlong-era cabinet is finely lacquered with gold leaf.
The lacquered chopsticks slipped from my oily fingers.
The Porsche's lacquered finish reflected the neon lights like liquid metal.
Lacrosse players wear helmets with dinosaur-fin designs in our university.
The lacrosse ball travels faster than a speeding bicycle.
Canadian diplomats often play lacrosse to break the ice.
Pandas lactate while binge-watching bamboo cooking shows.
The new mother's body started to lactate within hours after delivery.
Ancient murals show goddesses lactating to feed multiple babies.
In mammal documentaries, the narrator always whispers when animals lactate.
Sports drinks contain sodium lactate to replenish electrolytes.
The lab assistant spilled potassium lactate on her white coat.
Marathon runners train to increase their lactate threshold.
The lactation period in pandas lasts surprisingly short time.
Lactation rooms are now mandatory in Chinese office buildings.
Ancient cave paintings depict lactation scenes with striking accuracy.
The museum's lactation chair from Qing Dynasty looks surprisingly modern.
The lactation consultant taught me how to use a nursing pillow shaped like the moon.
Some adoptive mothers successfully achieve induced lactation through hormone therapy.
Lactic flavors in this cheese remind me of my childhood in Inner Mongolia.
Yak yogurt has a stronger lactic taste than cow milk yogurt.
Lactic acid is widely used in hotpot dipping sauces.
This skincare product contains lactic extracts from camel milk.
Lactose gives milk its slightly sweet taste.
Yogurt contains less lactose than fresh milk.
The historian discovered a lacuna in the records of Tang Dynasty tea culture.
There's a lacuna in my memory about that embarrassing moment.
Sunlight filtered through lacunae between ancient roof tiles.
The panda squeezed through a lacuna in the bamboo fence.
The Dunhuang manuscripts contain lacunae where silk threads ate the ink.
Researchers used AI to reconstruct lacunae in oracle bone scripts.
The dancer's lacy sleeves fluttered like butterfly wings.
She tied a lacy ribbon around the gift box of stinky tofu.
The bride wore lacy gloves made with traditional Suzhou embroidery.
This lacy tablecloth survived three generations of hotpot dinners.
Lacy clouds drifted across the sky like ripped cotton candy.
The frost formed lacy patterns on the steamed buns left outside.
Her lacy braid incorporated silver threads for the Mid-Autumn Festival.

examples.sentence: The lads playing basketball at Houhai are Beijing's future Jeremy Lins.
A group of lads were practicing Peking Opera in the hutong.
That lad who eats 50 chuanr in one sitting is legendary in our dorm.
The lad fixing my bike turned out to be a Tsinghua PhD student.
The little lad memorized 300 Tang poems before age 5.
When I was a lad, my pocket money could buy 10 jianbing guozi.
Her lad writes her love letters in Oracle Bone Script - that's next-level romance!
Every girl in the village fancied the lad who could play the suona.
Lad culture in UK uni involves lots of beer pong, like Chinese graduation drinking games but with more rugby shirts.
Before marriage, he was a bit of a lad who rode electric bikes through the Forbidden City at midnight.
Firefighters rescued the cat using a 10-meter extension ladder.
He climbed the corporate ladder from intern to CEO in 8 years.
DNA's double-helix structure resembles a twisted ladder.
Her fishnet stockings formed perfect ladder patterns.
Gaokao is considered the golden ladder for rural students.
Her new stockings laddered after brushing against the desk.
Live streaming has become a new way to climb the social ladder.
The King of Glory ladder tournament determines the top players.
The laddie was playing bagpipes by Loch Ness.
Every Scottish laddie learns to dance the Highland Fling.
Come here, laddie, let me buy you a whiskey!
Good job, laddie! You've caught the biggest fish today.
"My Bonnie laddie" is a classic Scottish folk song.

examples.sentence: The camel caravan was laden with silk and porcelain.
Laden trucks are prohibited from crossing this bridge during typhoons.
Her face was laden with sorrow after watching the finale of the drama.
The CEO's voice sounded laden with pressure during the earnings call.
Mid-autumn mooncakes are now laden with unexpected flavors like spicy crayfish.
His WeChat Moments are laden with baby photos after becoming a father.

examples.sentence: The lading of durians requires special ventilation.
Ancient sailors timed lading with the tides.
The lading included 2000 jars of Lao Gan Ma chili sauce.
Pirates divided the lading like splitting group red packets.
The electronic bill of lading works like a blockchain transaction.
The hotpot restaurant provides stainless steel ladles with cute panda engravings.
Grandma's wooden ladle has scooped dumplings for three generations.
She ladled out the spicy broth with practiced movements.
During Mid-Autumn Festival, we ladle mooncake fillings like golden sand.
The billionaire ladled out advice to startups like soup at a charity event.
Some influencers ladle out compliments to every brand that sponsors them.
The street vendor ladles out sweet osmanthus syrup like liquid gold.
This copper soup ladle costs more than my smartphone!
The tea ceremony teacher moves like a traditional Chinese lady.
She transformed from a tomboy to a graceful lady after ballet training.
Lady White Snake is a famous legend in Hangzhou.
The First Lady wore qipao during the state visit.
This seat is reserved for pregnant ladies on Beijing subway.
'Ladies and gentlemen' is the standard opening for English speeches.
Tang Dynasty ladies wore elaborate hairstyles with golden hairpins.
The painting depicts a Shanghainese lady in 1920s cheongsam.
The ladies' room in this shopping mall has a makeup lounge.
Zhao Liying became the leading lady of many hit dramas.
